Class ProjectMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • ProjectMethods

  • public class ProjectMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all methods used to create and modify Project objects.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProjectMethods

        public ProjectMethods()

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique

        private static int checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique(int userDefinedProjectNumber)
        This method checks if a project number provided by the user is unique.

        The method returns an integer 0 or 1. 0 means that the project number provided is unique, and 1 means that the number provided is already in the system.

        Parameters:
        userDefinedProjectNumber - integer that represents the project number in the database.
        Returns:
        returns an integer, where 0 means the project number is unique and 1 that it is a duplicate.

      • chekcIfProjNumberInt

        private static int chekcIfProjNumberInt(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                        java.lang.String newProjNum)
        This method checks if a project number provided by the user is a valid integer.

        The input from the user is saved in a string. The string is then parsed to an integer. If it cannot be converted to an integer, an error message is displayed and the user needs to provide an different input. The string is returned as an integer data type.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        newProjNum - String value that represents the project number to be converted to an integer.
        Returns:
        returns the integer value of the user string for the project number.

      • displayExistingProjectNumbers

        private static void displayExistingProjectNumbers()
        This method displays all existing project numbers that are currently in the database, along with the project name.

      • createNewProject

        public static Project createNewProject(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method requests the user to enter all project details and creates a new Project object.

        The method also checks the validity of the user input, for example if the project number entered is valid and unique. It also automatically generates a name form the building type and customer surname is no name is provided.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        Returns:
        returns the Project object created from the user input.
        See Also:
        #displayExistingProjectNumbers(), #chekcIfProjNumberInt(Scanner, String), #checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique(int), #checkIfAddressIsNew(String), #getERFForAddress(String), #determineProjectArchitectID(Scanner), #determineProjectContractorID(Scanner), #determineProjectCustomerID(Scanner), #createArchitectPersonObject(int), #createContractorPersonObject(int), #createCustomerPersonObject(int)

      • createAndWriteNewProjectToDatabase

        public static void createAndWriteNewProjectToDatabase(Project newProject)
        This method takes a Project object as input and writes it to the database.
        Parameters:
        newProject - Project object with all the fields needed to define a project.
        See Also:
        #getProjectNumber(), #getProjectName(), #getBuildingType(), #getProjectFee(), #getProjectTotalPaid(), #getAddress(), #getERFNumber(), #getProjectArchtect(), #getProjectContractor(), #getProjectCustomer(), #getProjectDeadline(), #getPersonName(), #getTelephoneNumber(), #getExitingArchitectID(String, String), #getExitingContractorID(String, String), #getExitingCustomerID(String, String), #getProjectStatus(), #setprojectCompletionDate(String), #checkIfAddressIsNew(String)

      • checkIfAddressIsNew

        private static int checkIfAddressIsNew(java.lang.String projectAddress)
        Method checks if a physical address is unique or is already existing in the system.

        The physical address is a primary key in the erf table and therefore cannot be added to the database more than once.

        Parameters:
        projectAddress - String representing the physical address of the project.
        Returns:
        returns an integer 0 if the address is not in the database and 1 if it is.

      • getERFForAddress

        private static java.lang.String getERFForAddress(java.lang.String projectAddress)
        This method obtains the ERF Number for an existing physical address.
        Parameters:
        projectAddress - String representing the physical address of the project.
        Returns:
        returns a string for the ERF Number.

      • editProjectDetails

        public static void editProjectDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method enables the user to edit a existing projects and/or people.

        The user can update the project fee, project total paid, project deadline as well as the contact details for the architect, customer and contractor.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #editProjectFeeCharged(Scanner), #editProjectPaidToDate(Scanner), #changeProjectDeadline(Scanner), #changeArchitectContactDetails(Scanner), #changeContractorContactDetails(Scanner), #changeCustomerContactDetails(Scanner), #getEditOption(Scanner)

      • editProjectFeeCharged

        private static void editProjectFeeCharged(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method edits an existing project's fee charged.

        The specific project is found based on the project number which is entered by the user. The new fee is requested and the record is updated in the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #displayProjectSummary(), #checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique(int), #chekcIfProjNumberInt(Scanner, String)

      • editProjectPaidToDate

        private static void editProjectPaidToDate(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method edits an existing project's total paid.

        The specific project is found based on the project number which is entered by the user. The new total paid is requested and the record is updated in the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #displayProjectSummary(), #checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique(int), #chekcIfProjNumberInt(Scanner, String)

      • changeProjectDeadline

        private static void changeProjectDeadline(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method edits an existing project's deadline.

        The specific project is found based on the project number which is entered by the user. The new deadline is requested and the record is updated in the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #displayProjectSummary(), #checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique(int), #chekcIfProjNumberInt(Scanner, String)

      • finalizeProject

        public static void finalizeProject(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method enables a user to finalize a project.

        The method changes the project status to complete and generates an invoice if the total fee has not been paid.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        See Also:
        #displayProjectSummary(), #checkIfProjectNumberIsUnique(int), #chekcIfProjNumberInt(Scanner, String), #determineProjectCustomer(int), #generateInvoice(Person, Double)

      • isProjectPaidInFull

        private static java.lang.Double isProjectPaidInFull(int projectNumber)
        This method returns the outstanding amount payable for a project based on the project number.
        Parameters:
        projectNumber - integer value that represents the project number..
        Returns:
        returns a double value which is the amount payable for the project.

      • determineProjectCustomer

        private static Person determineProjectCustomer(int projectNumber)
        This method obtains the customer information for a customer assigned to a specific project number.
        Parameters:
        projectNumber - integer value that represents the project number.
        Returns:
        returns a Person object - customer of the project.

      • changeProjectStatus

        private static void changeProjectStatus(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                        int projectNumber)
        This method updates the project status to finalized.

        The specific project is found based on the project number which is entered by the user. The status is set to Finalized and the record is updated in the database.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
        projectNumber - integer value that represents the project number.

      • displayIncompleteProjects

        public static void displayIncompleteProjects()
        This methods loops through all the projects in the database and displays all incompleted projects.

      • displayOutOfDateProjects

        public static void displayOutOfDateProjects()
        This method loops through all projects and displays all incomplete projects that are past their due dates.

      • findProjectByNumberOrName

        public static void findProjectByNumberOrName(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method searches for a project in the database based on a name or number and displays it to the user.
        Parameters:
        userInput - Scanner object to enable the user to provide input.
